definition: to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind
a breed of horse/variant of 歡|欢[huan1]

sentences.english: It used to be said that English people take their pleasures sadly.
sentences.chinese: 人们常说英国人哪怕遇上乐事也还是落落寡欢。

sentences.english: But among them , his nephew , misfitted , felt that he was going to die .
sentences.chinese: 可是在他们中间，他的外甥却落落寡欢，甚至想到死。

sentences.english: There are many ways to get a college degree and one of them is by taking classes right online at your own convenience.
sentences.chinese: 但是，班里的女生陈佳佳却感到自己总是落落寡欢。

definition: as if one had lost something (idiom)/to look or feel unsettled or distracted/to feel empty
to be preoccupied (idiom)/to be inattentive/to be frightened out of one's mind
long moan and short gasp (idiom); continually moaning and groaning in pain
dull and colorless (idiom); lacking vitality/not lively
